system.biography:
TitleFFF 415-2 Scribe
Birthday30 Azura 698
AppearanceAge 21, height 5â 6â, medium frame, weight 135 lb, attractive appearance, fair complexion, blonde hair, blue eyes
Medical/PsycheNone
Size5
ArmorLeather shoes, cloth leggings, long sleeve cloth shirt, cloth skirt, cloth tunic. Dagger. When travelling, add round shield, short bow, quiver (12 arrows) and broadsword.
Other EquipmentLoose parchment, ink, pens, and other writing implements
Valuables83d in silver in a money pouch
Notes

Biography

The child of Lars Forsetha and his second wife Brunhild Pelenby, Ygwelve grew up in a large and prosperous family in the thran hold of Stafen near Beleka. Her father, a respected pilot and member of the thrangaad, was able to afford a good education for his children. Ygwelve has a natural talent for languages and writing, and was trained as a scribe and translator.

Growing up, Ygwelveâs best friend was her older sister, Grimhilda; the two of them were constantly together and always getting into mischief. When Grimhilda announced she was leaving for Kyriheim, Ygwelve was distraught, knowing her sister would not be back for a long time. She tried to stow away on the ship, but her mother caught her. The sisters exchanged letters during the years away, which sparked a growing urge in Ygwelve to travel and see the world rather than do the work she was trained for. She also developed a knack for seeing things far away and knowing what was going to happen. When the opportunity came to leave Stafen and travel with her older sister, Ygwelve took it without hesitation. Her parents are unhappy with her choice, but did not try to stop her. They know Grimhilda will protect her.

Since coming to Geda, Ygwelve has earned Kjal Forsethaâs appreciation and respect for her abilities as a scribe, and administrator. Rather than stay at the keep, she has taken up residence near the tollway, to help ensure the Baronâs men collected the appropriate fees from travellers on the road.

Almost since the day of her arrival, the Hodiri warrior, Brynn, has courted her. She has visions of him and knows that someday he will be her husband, but she is not ready to settle down and so has chosen to ignore his advancesâ¦for now.

In 719, Ygwelve accompanied her sister on her travels through Melderyn, and enjoyed the trip immensely. Despite the potential dangers of travelling North to Kaldor, she is looking forward to the opportunity.

Adventure Hooks

The Vision: Ygwelve has a vision that a group of people (the PCs) will be able to assist her group with a task. When she sees the PCs, she approaches them.

Translator: The PCs need documents translated and hear of a travelling scribe who might be able to help them. Ygwelve is noticeably distraught when she reads the document, and refuses to translate it for them.

Kidnappers: The PCs are hired by a nobleman to kidnap Ygwelve and take her to a remote manor.

Credits
